net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite.editor

Class AbstractSimpleValueEditor<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.ComponentImpl
      • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.Container
        • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.component.composite.editor.AbstractSimpleValueEditor<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the value type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertyChangeListener, Iterable<Component>, EventListener, net.proteusframework.core.locale.LocaleContextSource, Component, ValueEditor<V>, Editable, ListCellRenderer, ParentComponent, TableCellRenderer, TreeCellRenderer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CalendarValueEditor, CheckboxValueEditor, ComboBoxValueEditor, LocalizedTextEditor, NumberEditor, ProgrammaticIdentifierEditor, TextEditor

    public abstract class AbstractSimpleValueEditor<V>
extends Container
implements ValueEditor<V>
    Implementation of ValueEditor for simple values.
    Author:
    Russ Tennant (russ@i2rd.com)

      • commitValue

        public V commitValue()
              throws MIWTException
        Description copied from interface: ValueEditor
        Commit changes from the UI to the internal value and return the internal value. Typically, the caller is responsible for persistence.
        Specified by:
        commitValue in interface ValueEditor<V>
        Returns:
        the value or null if no value was captured.
        Throws:
        MIWTException - on error.

      • getValue

        @Nullable
public V getValue()
        Description copied from interface: ValueEditor
        Get the internal value. This doesn't reflect any changes made in the UI. Use ValueEditor.validateUIValue(Notifiable) and ValueEditor.commitValue() to obtain state changes.
        Specified by:
        getValue in interface ValueEditor<V>
        Returns:
        the value.

      • getValueComponent

        public abstract Component getValueComponent()
        Get the value component. This component should implement Editable .
        Returns:
        the value component.

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: Component

        Called when a Component is first attached to a WindowManager. This means the Component should have valid return values from getApplication(), getLocaleContext(), getParent(). It is preferable to have all construction of the Component go here since a valid LocaleContext, Application object, etc., are available.

        When overriding this method, be sure to call the super class init(). init() is called only once for each Component. The parent component will have been init()ed before init() is called.

        NOTE: Do not call this method from application code. It is meant to be called by the WindowManager only.

        Specified by:
        init in interface Component
        Overrides:
        init in class ComponentImpl

      • setNullAndEmptyAreEquivalent

        public void setNullAndEmptyAreEquivalent(boolean nullAndEmptyEquivalent)
        Set the null and empty equivalent flag. Defaults to true. This is used by the default implementation of getModificationState() to determine if a change has been made. For example, a NULL string and an empty string would be equivalent when this flag is true.
        Parameters:
        nullAndEmptyEquivalent - the null and empty equivalent flag.

      • setUIValue

        public abstract void setUIValue(@Nullable
              V value)
        Set the UI value. This can cause the editor state to become ValueEditor.ModificationState.CHANGED. Normally, you should use setValue(Object).
        Parameters:
        value - the value.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(@Nullable
            V value)
        Description copied from interface: ValueEditor
        Set the value and update the UI.
        Specified by:
        setValue in interface ValueEditor<V>
        Parameters:
        value - the value. May be null to indicate the absence of a value.

      • setValueValidator

        public void setValueValidator(Validator validator)
        Set the validator. See CommonValidationText for common messages.
        Parameters:

      • validateUIValue

        public boolean validateUIValue(net.proteusframework.core.notification.Notifiable notifiable)
        Description copied from interface: ValueEditor
        Validate the value from the current state of the UI. This should return false for any case that ValueEditor.commitValue() would throw an Exception.
        Specified by:
        validateUIValue in interface ValueEditor<V>
        Parameters:
        notifiable - notifiable to send messages.
        Returns:
        true if the value passed validation; otherwise false.
